🎥 Head Coach Bruce Cassidy: "I couldn't be more excited. Great group of players here that want to win. Been very close. Hopefully, we can all go hand in hand and get us over the top."  

Full stream: https://t.co/CHD48LIBLR 

#VegasBorn https://t.co/5GYQNaYS3n
“It’s quite a vibe here.” - Coach Cassidy #VegasBorn https://t.co/jZnGiLEMdr
“I want my name on the Stanley Cup. I believe this team has the ability to do that. I believe if we can take care of business, everything will fall into place.”

“Now I’m starting to see the communities of Vegas outside of the strip. It’s really appealing to me. I have a young family and you want to be part of a community. That’s the part I’m going to get to know even more in the next few days that really excites us.”

"We want to be attack-oriented. We don’t want to sit back. We’re not going out there wanting to win 1-0 every night. You have to be comfortable in close games, but we want to put teams on their heels. We want to score goals but not at the expense of fire-wagon hockey."

GM Kelly McCrimmon:

Bruce embodies so many of the traits we were looking for. He has a great record of success. Any way you want to measure the performance of a team, his teams have been extremely successful.

Head Coach Bruce Cassidy:

I want to start by thanking Bill Foley, Kelly McCrimmon and George McPhee for putting their trust in me. It’s a privilege and an honor to be a head coach in the National Hockey League so I’m very grateful for the opportunity here in Vegas.

Coach is ready to go, Vegas 💯

GM Kelly McCrimmon on Mark Stone: Mark will “quite likely” have back surgery on Wednesday and would be available for training camp.
Missing the playoffs was a humbling experience for the team. All those things add up to shape the attitude heading into next season.

It's a decision that ultimately came from me. I talked with George, we went to Bill and here we are today. It's not easy. You do what you think is best for the organization and that's why we're here today.
I’m expecting a sense of excitement and I’m expecting guys being very anxious to get to training camp. I keep using the term “a mindset of something to prove.”

GM Kelly McCrimmon: Head coach Pete DeBoer and assistants Steve Spott and Ryan McGill have been relieved of their duties. 

Assistant coaches Ryan Craig and Misha Donskov will remain on staff. Goalie coach Mike Rosati will interview with the new staff when they are appointed.
Knights Report 5/16/22 - Kelly McCrimmon addresses media on Golden Knights coaching updates followed by analysis from Daren Millard and Gary Lawless https://t.co/Nz7B5H9aWX
GM Kelly McCrimmon’s press conference will be streamed live on Twitter, YouTube, Facebook and Twitch at 1pm PT. #VegasBorn
GM Kelly McCrimmon will speak to the media at 1 p.m.

Welcome back, Coach! 💜🐴
@HSKnights Let’s go lil sib!!! 🔥

Good luck to the @LVAces! Their season tips off tonight in Phoenix 🏀

Let’s go, ladies! ♠️♦️ https://t.co/LryiYUi1Bx

🎥 Whitecloud: We have to be pros about it and learn from it. Take the good things we did from this year, the bad things and come back ready next year. Don't make the same mistakes and have our group ready to go and give ourselves a chance at winning it next year. https://t.co/an7f3vFDf5

🎥 Theodore: This is a good summer for a lot of guys to get some rest. We had a lot of guys banged up and a lot of guys playing through something. If we can utilize this summer to fuel us for next year, I think we're going to be ready. https://t.co/4l21lLzWM7

🎥 McNabb: We believe in this group. We went through a lot this year. We're not where we want to be. It's tough sitting here watching those games. We know where we want to be and we're confident in our group. https://t.co/qtkbRWuzto

Stopped by Bob Miller Middle School for Teacher Appreciation Week! ✏️📚🍎

We love our teachers! 🤗 #VegasBorn https://t.co/XOuPMD90BS

🎥 Pacioretty: Our goal is to win the Stanley Cup here every year. When you don't do that and you don't even get a shot at it, then ya you have to look in the mirror and say that you underperformed. https://t.co/fueaeVNscN

🎥 Martinez: In this game, you face adversity. There's no doubt about it this sucks. You don't want to be watching hockey this time of year. With that adversity comes opportunity comes a challenge and I never doubted this group for a second. https://t.co/WHqLM9OIOt

🎥 Karlsson: Humans are built where you're kind of your biggest critic. You're always weighing yourself down. You got to remind yourself of the good stuff you do. I think that's a lesson for everyone, honestly. Not just in sports but in everyday life as well. https://t.co/7c70VmXrkt
🎥 Marchessault: I think it's on the veteran group that we have here to make sure that we're hard to play against every night. https://t.co/dLSQvDjLRs

🎥 GM Kelly McCrimmon: As much as we overcame those injuries in the first half of the season, they were harder to overcome in the second half of the season. 

More comments: https://t.co/mVBEbAQgRo https://t.co/2xuNQA5Kd3

🎥 Stone: We've got to get back to having that killer instinct mindset. Outwork your opponent and then when you have the skill of the players we have if you get that work ethic, it's going to be a tough team to beat. 

Full comments: https://t.co/MwO9CHUpgv https://t.co/6SCYWiIGBu

🎥 DeBoer: The potential of the group sits as a pit in your stomach because at the beginning of the year we all recognized what could have been. When you're watching playoff hockey last night, you know with a healthy group we should be right there. https://t.co/rEW1pBQVcx

🎥 Eichel: When you have expectations like we did and you don't meet them, it's frustrating. I think we all understand the team that we can be. There's a lot of good to build off of it. https://t.co/a5hZMWZOwa
…I’m very disappointed we didn’t make the playoffs. I believe strongly that we could have and should have.

GM Kelly McCrimmon: To have a championship team, you have to get better over the course of the year. I’ve always believed your team has to be better in the second half than the first half, then better in the playoffs than the second half and keep improving as playoffs go on…
Karlsson: I feel very hungry. I know the other guys feel the same. We want to go out and make sure this was just a lesson learned.
William Karlsson: We have to go back to being the relentless team we can be. I look around the locker room and there’s no doubt we can get back to that.
Jonathan Marchessault: We shouldn’t have any excuses. We had a chance to get into the playoffs. Other teams gave us chances and we didn’t earn the right to be there.
Stone: You kinda have to have that core six to eight guys who have that leadership. I think we have it. I really do.
Mark Stone: It’s disappointing this team isn’t competing right now. On paper we feel like we have a team that can win it all.
Whitecloud: Vegas is home for me. I don’t need a break from this city. I love all the people and I love all the fans.

Whitecloud: There’s no guideline to being a leader. Everyone does it in their own way. I’ve been in various levels of hockey and school and I’ve learned you can be a leader in many different scenarios.
Zach Whitecloud: For us, it’s huge to get back to our identity and find what works for us.
Jack Eichel: It was a really easy transition for me to this organization. The guys in the room made it easy for me.
Shea Theodore: We felt like we were a team where if we squeaked into playoffs we had a good chance of winning.
Max Pacioretty: We like what we have here. Everyone feels strongly that we have what it takes.

There’s never been a lack of work. I’m confident in the group that we will embrace this opportunity to get better and be stronger for it. It probably sounds like a lot of BS but it actually is true. If guys embrace this the right way, we can be even better going forward.
Alec Martinez on his injury: From an individual standpoint, it’s the toughest thing I’ve had to go through in hockey. It was fairly serious and a very fluky thing.
I know other people have gotten sliced before and I didn’t know it could do what it did to the extent it did. Our medical staff has been awesome.
DeBoer: I think our group had a ton of adversity thrown at them. I really felt they gave me what they had every night.
Head Coach Pete DeBoer: I want to coach this team again. We never got a chance to do what we’re capable of doing. We’re excited about this group. This type of season has to fuel you for next year.

The final #SLGND podcast of the season is out now! Tune in as the guys review the Golden Knights’ fifth season and where they go from here 🏒
